en.title: MXC Brings Smart City IoT Standard to South Korea

post.content:
## MXC Brings Smart City IoT Standard to South Korea
**Berlin, Germany, January 31, 2019 **— Berlin-based blockchain non-profit [MXC](https://www.mxc.org/?utm_campaign=Public%20Relations&utm_source=press-release&utm_content=enlink) announced the 2019 launch of their Smart City IoT Standard, the MXProtocol, in South Korea in cooperation with Enlink. With this partnership, MXProtocol will be added to the environmental monitoring, power management, and earthquake detection hardware developed by [Enlink](http://enlink.kr/).
“This is a huge opportunity for South Koreans to participate in environmental monitoring and disaster management,” said MXC CEO and co-founder Sheen Xin Hu. “By integrating MXProtocol in these solutions, companies, and individuals can deploy it knowing that they are helping their communities while collecting valuable data that can be shared and traded through the MXC inter-chain data market.”

South Korea is a dynamic and powerful market for cryptocurrency solutions. This partnership marks MXC’s first step into this market, with a clear focus on giving blockchain a true purpose within the IoT word.

“MXC is breaking ground in improving the reliability of wireless data transmissions while encouraging the collection of data,” said Dawin Lim, CEO at Enlink. “We are happy to partner with them to ensure timely and reliable wireless data transmission in South Korea.”

Enlink will begin testing the MXProtocol in their insect traps, semiconductor line monitoring system, fine dust signal system, and earthquake detection system in 2019 with full deployment planned for 2020.

MXProtocol improves the efficiency of wireless data solutions and encourages the collaboration and sharing of the collected data. Devices enabled with the MXProtocol will be able to list the data they collect in the inter-chain data market. Transactions in the market will be handled using the Machine Xchange Coin (MXC). MXC is currently available on [Huobi Korea](https://www.huobi.co.kr/ko-kr/notices/457?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social_huobiofficial&utm_campaign=mxc_notice&utm_term=mxc_event_notice).

Want to stay in the loop on MXC News and Updates? Sign up for our weekly newsletter.

ENLINK was established in 2013 with the aim of developing and distributing valuable products in the world by combining analog and digital technologies. Current products are focused on earthquake detection and monitoring of environmental patterns.

The MXC Foundation is a purpose-built non-profit with the mission to inspire fast, efficient, decentralized data exchanges using LPWAN and Blockchain technology. The MXC team believes that MXC paired with LPWAN is the next step in the fourth industrial revolution, creating a Smart City Standard for the Future of IoT.

hans.title: MXC极域将智能城市物联网标准引入韩国

post.content:
**德国柏林时间2019年1月31日** — 总部位于柏林的区块链非营利组织MXC极域与Enlink合作，于2019年在韩国推出了智能城市物联网标准MXC极域协议。 通过此次合作，MXC极域协议将被添加到[Enlink](http://enlink.kr/)开发的环境监控、电源管理和地震检测硬件中。

MXC极域首席执行官兼联合创始人胡莘说：“这对韩国人来说是一个巨大的机会，可以参与环境监测和自然灾难管理。” “通过将MXC极域协议集成到这些解决方案、公司和个人中，并且在部署时，可以通过MXC极域的链间数据市场共享和交易的宝贵数据，来帮助社区。”

韩国有着活跃和强大的加密货币解决方案市场。 这项合作伙伴关系标志着MXC极域进入该市场的第一步，明确致力于在IoT（物联网）一词中赋予区块链真正的目的。

Enlink首席执行官Dawin Lim表示：“ MXC极域在提高无线数据传输的可靠性的同时，也在鼓励数据收集方面取得突破。” “我们很高兴与他们合作，以确保在韩国及时、可靠地进行无线数据传输。”

Enlink将于2019年开始在其昆虫陷阱、半导体线监视系统、细尘信号系统和地震检测系统中测试MXC极域协议，并计划在2020年进行全面部署。

MXC极域协议提高了无线数据解决方案的效率，并鼓励协作和共享收集的数据。 启用了MXC极域协议的设备将能够列出他们在链间数据市场中收集的数据。 市场上的交易将使用Machine Xchange Coin（MXC极域）处理。 MXC极域目前可在[韩国火币](https://www.huobi.co.kr/ko-kr/notices/457?utm_source=twitter&utm_medium=social_huobiofficial&utm_campaign=mxc_notice&utm_term=mxc_event_notice)上使用。

想要一直关注MXC极域的新闻和更新？ 订阅我们的每周新闻吧。

ENLINK成立于2013年，旨在通过结合模拟和数字技术在世界范围内开发和分销有价值的产品。 当前的产品专注于地震检测和环境模式监测。

MXC极域基金会是一个专门的非营利性组织，其使命是使用LPWAN和区块链技术激发快速、高效、分散的数据交换。 MXC极域团队认为，将MXC极域与LPWAN配对是第四次工业革命的下一步，这将为IoT的未来创建智能城市标准。
